skill.name: ceo-advisor
skill.description: Executive leadership guidance for strategic decision-making, organizational development, and stakeholder management. Includes strategy analyzer, financial scenario modeling, board governance frameworks, and investor relations playbooks. Use when planning strategy, preparing board presentations, managing investors, developing organizational culture, making executive decisions, or when user mentions CEO, strategic planning, board meetings, investor updates, organizational leadership, or executive strategy.
skill.summary: Executive leadership guidance for strategic decision-making, organizational development, and stakeho...
skill.author: alirezarezvani

security_audit.summary: All 90 static findings are false positives. The analyzer incorrectly flagged markdown documentation formatting (backticks) as shell commands, business terminology as reconnaissance patterns, and strategy framework references as cryptographic vulnerabilities. Python scripts contain only business logic with no network, filesystem, or command execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: CEOs face complex decisions about strategy, governance, and organizational leadership without structured frameworks. This skill provides comprehensive tools for strategic planning, financial modeling, board management, and stakeholder relations to drive better executive outcomes.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes strategic position using Porter's Five Forces, SWOT, BCG Matrix, and Ansoff Matrix frameworks
Models financial scenarios with risk-adjusted projections, NPV, IRR, and sensitivity analysis
Provides board meeting preparation templates, governance structures, and communication playbooks
Guides investor relations with fundraising strategy, pitch deck structure, and earnings cycle management
Supports organizational culture transformation with leadership development and change management frameworks
limitations: Does not provide legal, tax, or regulatory advice - consult qualified professionals for compliance matters
Requires user to input company-specific data for accurate strategic and financial analysis
Cannot replace human judgment - recommendations are frameworks for decision support, not prescriptions

use_cases.title: First-time CEO onboarding
use_cases.description: New CEOs learn executive rhythms, board management, and stakeholder communication strategies

use_cases.title: Strategic planning cycles
use_cases.description: Established executives structure annual strategy reviews, board presentations, and OKR cascades

use_cases.title: Governance excellence
use_cases.description: Board members and executives prepare effective board packages and manage investor relations

prompt_templates.title: Quick strategic analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the CEO Advisor strategy analyzer to help me understand our current strategic position. Our company has 35% market share, 45% revenue growth, and we're facing increasing competitive rivalry. Provide a SWOT analysis and 3 strategic options.

prompt_templates.title: Board prep guidance
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me prepare for my quarterly board meeting. I need to present Q3 results, request budget approval for a new initiative, and address board concerns about market competition. What should be in my board package?

prompt_templates.title: Financial scenarios
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the financial scenario analyzer to model three options: aggressive growth (50% revenue increase with higher costs), moderate growth (30% increase), and conservative (15% increase with cost reduction). What's the risk-adjusted recommendation?

prompt_templates.title: Organizational change
prompt_templates.description: Lead organizational culture transformation with structured phases and reinforcement mechanisms to embed new behaviors across the company.
prompt_templates.prompt: Our company is growing from 50 to 200 employees and our culture is fraying. Help me design a culture transformation program using the CEO Advisor leadership framework. What are the key phases and how do we measure success?

output_examples.input: Help me prepare for my first board meeting as CEO of a Series B startup
output: Key Components: CEO Report (3-5 pages) with executive summary, performance highlights, strategic progress, key challenges, and specific asks
Timeline: T-4 weeks (agenda), T-2 weeks (materials), T-1 week (distribution)
Board Package Structure: Dashboard (1 page), Financial Review (5 pages), Strategic Updates (10 pages), Risk Register (2 pages)
Key Messages to Prepare: Growth trajectory, competitive position, financial performance, strategic progress, future outlook

output_examples.input: Should we acquire our competitor? How do we evaluate this?
output: Strategic Fit Analysis: Synergies identification, cultural alignment, market position enhancement
Financial Analysis: DCF valuation, ROI projections, integration cost estimates
Due Diligence Checklist: Legal/regulatory issues, technology compatibility, talent retention risks
100-Day Plan Elements: Communication strategy, success metrics, integration milestones

best_practices: Structure strategic decisions using frameworks like DECIDE (Define, Establish criteria, Consider alternatives, Identify best, Develop action, Evaluate) before committing resources
Prepare board materials at least 2 weeks in advance with clear asks, supporting data, and anticipated questions to build board confidence
Regularly assess organizational health through employee engagement surveys, leadership 360 feedback, and cultural pulse checks to catch issues early
anti_patterns: Avoid making major strategic decisions without structured frameworks - gut feelings without data lead to predictable failures
Do not surprise the board with unexpected issues - maintain transparency and communicate problems early with mitigation plans
Avoid neglecting organizational culture during growth phases - cultural atrophy is difficult to reverse and expensive to fix

faq.question: What strategic frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill includes Porter's Five Forces, SWOT analysis, BCG Matrix, Ansoff Matrix, and the DECIDE decision framework for comprehensive strategic planning.

faq.question: How does the financial scenario analyzer work?
faq.answer: It models multiple business scenarios with growth projections, calculates NPV and IRR, performs sensitivity analysis, and provides risk-adjusted recommendations.

faq.question: Can this skill help with fundraising preparation?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides pitch deck structure, investor communication playbooks, fundraising stage guidance (Seed through IPO), and valuation approaches.

faq.question: What board governance materials are included?
faq.answer: Board composition templates, meeting preparation timelines, board package structures, communication best practices, and difficult conversation handling.

faq.question: Does this skill cover organizational culture?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides culture transformation roadmaps, leadership development frameworks, change management processes, and embedding mechanisms.

faq.question: What decision types does the executive framework cover?
faq.answer: Growth decisions (market expansion, product development, M&A), resource allocation, organizational restructuring, leadership changes, and crisis management.
